page.title: 20The Cilcain/Pantymwyn Shows
page.content: The major local events are the annual village shows, held each summer. The Cilcain Show has been held in its present form since 1954, and this year activities included a dog-show and competitions for home-made wine, cake- making, gardening, flower-arranging, arts and crafts, and photography. A major attraction is the Mountain Race, from the village to the Jubilee Tower on the summit of Moel Fammau and back, a distance of about 6km which good runners complete in under 30 minutes. The Pantymwyn Show features a horse- show and gymkhana, with many classes of competitions, in addition to many other activities. The growing interest in running in recent years led to the establishment of the 'Leete Race' in 1980, and in 1984 a shorter 'Rocks Race' was introduced, which children are allowed to enter.
